roleset.name: provide a lining, accompany in line-like fashion
roleset.note: LINE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'line' based on sentences in wsj and automaticexpansion via verbnet. (from line.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: unstated lining
example.text: How many government programs and policies exist because they line the pockets of political insiders?

example.name: Enron stocks?
example.text: [Wall Street]-1 is just about ready *trace*-1 to line the bird cage with paper stocks.

example.name: All args
example.text: Bert's lining of the basement's walls with lead was meant to convert it into a fallout shelter.

roleset.name: puts lines on
roleset.note: LINE-V NOTES: Probably will only occur in lined faces and lined paper. (from line.03-v)

example.name: adjectival
example.text: He looked at the lined face with vague interest ; ; he felt [0] he was noting it , as if it were something [0]he might think about [*T*-1] when he grew stronger [*T*-2] .

roleset.name: stand in line
roleset.note: LINE_UP-V NOTES: In the agentive and passive 'line up' acquires the sense of 'arrange'. (from line.02-v)

example.name: ergative
example.text: At a recent trade show, convention-goers lined up to view a new Specialized bike frame that weighs just 2.7 pounds -- a pound less than the lightest mountain-bike frame on the market.
example.arg: to view a new Specialized bike frame that weighs just 2.7 pounds -- a pound less than the lightest mountain-bike frame on the market

example.name: agentive
example.text: And, in addition to a crack team of sailors, Mr. Isler has lined up some real brass to help him finance the syndicate.
example.arg: in addition to a crack team of sailors
to help him finance the syndicate

example.name: passivized
example.text: [U.S. buyers]-1 have already been lined *trace*-1 up.
